question: Which treatment leads to an increase in neutrophil counts in severe congenital neutropenia?
ideal_answer: In phase I/II/III studies in patients with severe congenital and cyclic neutropenia, treatment with recombinant human granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (r-metHuG-CSF) resulted in a rise in the absolute neutrophil counts (ANC) and a reduction in infections
